org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support
Class AeInvokeRetryPolicy

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support.AeInvokeRetryPolicy
public class AeInvokeRetryPolicy
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates all of the retry code for the invoke activity

reschedule

public boolean reschedule(IAeFault aFault)
                   throws AeBusinessProcessException
Tests the policies associated with this endpoint to see if the invoke should be rescheduled for a later attempt. Ideally this could be handled by an invoke handler itself, but for internal policy handling it is simpler to do here since all the neccesary info is at hand.

Parameters:
aFault - The fault which occured diuring the invoke.
Returns:
true if the invoke has been rescheduled and the fault should be ignored.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

rescheduleFromRetryAssertion

protected boolean rescheduleFromRetryAssertion(IAeFault aFault,
                                               org.w3c.dom.Element aRetryAssertionElem)
                                        throws AeBusinessProcessException
Returns true if based on the passed retry assertion and fault the current invoke has rescheduled itself.

Parameters:
aFault - the fault returned from invoke.
aRetryAssertionElem - The assertion element to test
Returns:
true if the invoke has been rescheduled.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

isFaultEligibleForRetry

protected boolean isFaultEligibleForRetry(IAeFault aFault,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Element aAssertionEl)
Checks the current fault against the list of faults for inclusion or exclusion to determine if the current fault is elegible for retry.

Parameters:
aFault -
aAssertionEl -

isFaultNameMatch

private boolean isFaultNameMatch(javax.xml.namespace.QName aFaultName,
                                 java.lang.String aString)
Tests if the passed qname and string qname match. The string qname can contain wildcards in the form of an asterisk. The string qname is in the format {namespace}localpart.

Parameters:
aFaultName - the fault name to test.
aString - qname string in form that can be passed to valurOf in QName. The format is {namespace}localpart.
Returns:
boolean true if the fault names match.

callRetryCheckService

protected int callRetryCheckService(java.lang.String aService,
                                    IAeFault aFault)
Calls the passed service to decide whether and when the invoke should be retried.

Parameters:
aService - the service to invoke.
aFault - the fault which is being checked for retry.
Returns:
int which will be the number of seconds before retrying, -1 means no retry,

createRetryCheckInput

protected org.w3c.dom.Document createRetryCheckInput(IAeFault aFault)
                                              throws AeException
Returns:
the document to be passed to the retry check service operation.
Throws:
AeException
